intro: Sloetiopsis, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Lesotho. The plants are shrubs with small, needle-like leaves and produce clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. Sloetiopsis species are adapted to nutrient-poor soils and thrive in cool, moist environments. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh conditions.
